com.google.publicalerts.cap.feed

Class CapFeedParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.publicalerts.cap.feed.CapFeedParser

  • public class CapFeedParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses feeds of alerts, the entries in those feeds, and the CAP alerts in those entries.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CapFeedParser.DocBuilder
      Pulled out of Rome to take advantage of their XEE prevention

    • Field Detail

      • CAP_MIME_TYPE

        public static final java.lang.String CAP_MIME_TYPE
        Both of the following constants have been requested as MIME types for CAP. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-barnes-atoca-cap-mime-01.

        However, official status of the type is unclear. Neither are currently listed at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALTERNATE_CAP_MIME_TYPE

        public static final java.lang.String ALTERNATE_CAP_MIME_TYPE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CapFeedParser

        public CapFeedParser(boolean validate)
        Creates a new parser with no XML signature validation.
        Parameters:
        validate - true to validate the feed as it is parsed

      • CapFeedParser

        public CapFeedParser(boolean validate,
             XmlSignatureValidator validator)
        Creates a new parser.
        Parameters:
        validate - true to validate the feed as it is parsed
        validator - Used to validate XML signatures on alerts, if validate is true. If null, no signature validation is done.

      • parseFeed

        public SyndFeed parseFeed(java.io.Reader reader)
                   throws FeedException,
                          CapFeedException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses the given ATOM or RSS feed, provided as a Reader.
        Parameters:
        reader - reader for the given feed.
        Returns:
        the parsed Rome SyndFeed
        Throws:
        FeedException - if the XML could not be parsed
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if XML could be parsed, but is not a feed type supported by Rome
        CapFeedException - if validate is true and the feed is not valid

      • parseAlerts

        public java.util.List<Alert> parseAlerts(SyndFeed feed)
                                  throws CapException,
                                         NotCapException
        Parses the CAP alerts assumed to be in the <content> bodies of the entries of the given feed.
        Parameters:
        feed - the feed to process
        Returns:
        a list of CAP alerts
        Throws:
        CapException - if any of the alerts are invalid
        NotCapException - if the feed has no <entry>, or any of the <content> do not contain a CAP alert

      • parseAlert

        public Alert parseAlert(SyndEntry entry)
                 throws CapException,
                        NotCapException
        Parses the CAP alert assumed to be in the body of the first <content> entry.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to process
        Returns:
        the CAP alert in the first <content> body
        Throws:
        CapException - if any of the alerts are invalid
        NotCapException - if any of the <content>s do not contain a CAP alert

      • parseAlert

        public Alert parseAlert(SyndEntry entry,
               Reasons.Builder reasons)
                 throws CapException,
                        NotCapException
        Parses the CAP alert assumed to be in the body of the first <content> entry.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to process
        reasons - a collection to which to add any non-fatal errors, warnings or recommendations during parsing
        Returns:
        the CAP alert in the first <content> body
        Throws:
        CapException - if the alert is unparseable as XML
        NotCapException - if any of the <content>s do not contain a CAP alert

      • getCapUrl

        public java.lang.String getCapUrl(SyndEntry entry)
        Returns the link in the entry that most likely points to the full version of CAP.

        For RSS: If there is a non-empty link, it is returned, otherwise null

        For Atom: If there is only one link in the entry, and it has no a type, it is assumed to be the CAP URL and is returned. If there are multiple links, the link with type "application/cap+xml" is returned. null is returned otherwise.

        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to extract a URL from
        Returns:
        the URL, or null if no suitable URL is found
